page.title: 19Chalfont House Ch St Peter
page.content: Chalfont House is situated east of the London Road.Now owned by British Alcan it was once the most important house in Chalfont St Peter.Most of its grounds are now the Gerrards Cross golf course. It was built in 1792 and owned by the Hibbert family who had made their money n the slave trade. The first Lombardy poplars to be seen in this country were grown in the park and there is an attractive Cedar tree by the house.Edward Lutyens designed an Italian garden there. The River Misbourne flowing through the parkland has been dammed to form a lake that is a home for much wildlife. The house was once used as a hotel for some time. Public footpaths go through the park giving pleasant views of the house and grounds.
